response:
Urgent neuroimaging is required to characterise the lesion (distinguish between tumour, abscess, inflammation, or ischaemia). Lumbar puncture is essential given the febrile presentation to rule out meningitis/encephalitis. Blood tests are needed to assess for infection, inflammation, and autoimmune causes.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Cervical Spine with contrast", "Lumbar Puncture (CSF microscopy, culture, viral PCR, oligoclonal bands)", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Blood cultures", "Coagulation screen", "Viral PCR panel (HSV, VZV, EBV)", "Autoimmune encephalitis screen", "Aquaporin-4 and MOG antibodies", "Chest X-ray"]
